title: ATMOS to Use Re-Entry Tech to Rapidly Deploy Autonomous Ground Vehicles
summary:
ATMOS Space Cargo has partnered with ARX Robotics to leverage orbital re-entry logistics for the rapid deployment of autonomous ground systems. Founded in 2022, ARX Robotics offers a modular autonomous ground vehicle called GEREON. According to the company, GEREON can support a wide range of missions, including reconnaissance, data relaying, surveillance and patrol, cargo transport, […]
The post ATMOS to Use Re-Entry Tech to Rapidly Deploy Autonomous Ground Vehicles appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Space agencies grapple with potential changes to Artemis
summary:
Space agencies working on the NASA-led Artemis lunar exploration campaign said they plan to continue work on their contributions despite NASA’s current budget uncertainty, even as some consider alternative cooperation.

title: Hubble Comes Face-to-Face with Spiral’s Arms
summary: The spiral galaxy NGC 3596 is on display in this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image that incorporates six different wavelengths of light. NGC 3596 is situated 90 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Leo, the Lion. British astronomer Sir William Herschel first documented the galaxy in 1784. NGC 3596 appears almost perfectly face-on when […]

summary:

title: Biomass completes a relay race of a LEOP
summary: Mission control at ESA’s European Space Operations Centre has completed the critical Launch and Early Orbit Phase (LEOP) for ESA’s Biomass, after nine days of intense work.
